revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-07 13:47:33.000000000', 'files': ['freezer_api/tests/unit/test_elastic.py', 'freezer_api/storage/elastic.py', 'freezer_api/tests/unit/test_actions.py', 'freezer_api/api/v1/actions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/freezer-api/commit/9ba20f27bd0996e014df64ec92cd7ff24e81cea0', 'message': 'Update behaviour for deleting actions in Freezer API

This should change that behaviour so that a HTTP 404 Not Found is

commit_message:
Update behaviour for deleting actions in Freezer API

When attempting to delete a non existing action in Freezer API, the
previous behaviour was to return a HTTP 204 No Content message,
the same behaviour as if the action did in fact exist.

This should change that behaviour so that a HTTP 404 Not Found is
returned instead to make it consistent with api-wg guidelines.

Change-Id: I02e019e323c13f4c9d60d6c714c51e5cabc4f3b4
Closes-Bug: #1588343
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer-api refs/changes/71/326471/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deleted_id = self.db.delete_action(user_id=user_id, action_id=action_id) if deleted_id: resp.body = {'action_id': action_id} resp.status = falcon.HTTP_204 else: resp.body = {'title': 'Not found', 'description': 'No document found with ID %s' % action_id} resp.status = falcon.HTTP_404
deleted_lines: self.db.delete_action(user_id=user_id, action_id=action_id) resp.body = {'action_id': action_id} resp.status = falcon.HTTP_204

commit_message:
Adding some tempest tests to ensure that the API
responds correctly to a DELETE /v1/actions/:action_id
request where action_id does not exist with a HTTP 404
(Not Found) as per api-wg

Depends-On: If3b13b7dcea390461f54f0c7138e3b3994a35d03
Depends-On: I076cb821d188ecde5ee776701f0785248f8d3565

added_lines: deleted_id = self.db.delete_action(user_id=user_id, action_id=action_id) if deleted_id: # HTTP 204 responses don't contain a body. resp.status = falcon.HTTP_204 else: description = 'No document found with ID %s' % action_id resp.body = {'title': 'Not found', 'description': description} resp.status = falcon.HTTP_404
deleted_lines: self.db.delete_action(user_id=user_id, action_id=action_id) resp.body = {'action_id': action_id} resp.status = falcon.HTTP_204

commit_message:
[networking] Typos

This patch addresses comments from CR:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/335662.

Change-Id: Ide51b9cdacf9958b588c2f967c27e9fcab44cd59
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/94/336894/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Add LBaaS panels to Dashboard ----------------------------- The Dashboard panels for managing LBaaS v2 are available starting with the Mitaka release. branch that matches the installed version of Dashboard:#. Install the Dashboard panel plug-in: ``neutron-lbaas-dashboard/enabled`` directory into the Dashboard ``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled`` directory. This step ensures that Dashboard can find the plug-in when it enumerates all of its available panels. #. Enable the plug-in in Dashboard by editing the ``local_settings.py`` file and setting ``enable_lb`` to ``True`` in the ``OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK``#. If Dashboard is configured to compress static files for better performance (usually set through ``COMPRESS_OFFLINE`` in ``local_settings.py``), optimize the static files again:To find the panel, click on :guilabel:`Project` in Dashboard, then click the :guilabel:`Network` drop-down menu and select :guilabel:`Load Balancers`.
deleted_lines: Add LBaaS panels in Horizon --------------------------- Horizon panels for managing LBaaSv2 are available starting with the Mitaka release. branch that matches the installed version of Horizon:#. Install the Horizon panel plugin: ``neutron-lbaas-dashboard/enabled`` directory into Horizon's ``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled`` directory. This step ensures that Horizon can find the plugin when it enumerates all of its available panels. #. Enable the plugin in Horizon by editing the ``local_settings.py`` file and setting ``enable_lb`` to ``True`` in the ``OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK``#. If Horizon is configured to compress static files for better performance (usually set via ``COMPRESS_OFFLINE`` in the ``local_settings.py``), the static files must be optimized again:To find the panel, click on :guilabel:`Project` in Horizon, then click the :guilabel:`Network` drop down, and click :guilabel:`Load Balancers`.

commit_message:
Enable strategy parameters

Strategy provides parameters to customize algorithm behavior. End user
could query then specify parameters for their requirements.

Change-Id: Id097db5f6e79c94b57674c8e5d55b06098abf18c
Implements-bp: optimization-threshold

commit_message:
Re-license charm as Apache-2.0

All contributors to this charm have agreed to the switch
from GPL v3 to Apache 2.0; switch to Apache-2.0 license
as agreed so we can move forward with official project status.

commit_message:
[training-labs] Add PXE feature to training-labs

Change-Id: I5a48e96a7294a39e4528bae8a7e75eaa7a2a65e4
Signed-off-by: Julen Larrucea <julenl@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/docs-specs refs/changes/02/323402/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Trainig-labs PXE server ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+spec/pxe-server-osbash Training-labs can currently install OpenStack into local virtual machines. But what happens if we want to build a test environment on an unsupported virtual environment, or even in physical machines? Provided that osbash already builds the framework to install a Virtual Machine (VM), we can install on it a PXE (Preboot eXecution Environment) server, which will provision Ubuntu into a given network. Setting this VM with bridged networking can allow to just plug our laptop into a network switch, and install OpenStack "the osbash way" on real hardware. Proposed change =============== Create a new install option called ``pxeserver`` with the following workflow: * Create the Base disk as usual * Clone the Base disk and set the network card for bridged networking * Install/configure the required services: This includes: dhcpd, apache and tftpd Also, in order not to interfere with the default management/ext networks, there is a dedicated router and dns server, which will route the traffic from the external network into the PXE network. This provides internet access to the machines, for downloading packages. * The kickstart file will provision an Ubuntu image with a custom menu, similar to the one in BOMSI, from where one can chose which machine is going to be installed (i.e. controller or compute) Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: * Julen Larrucea (julenl) Other contributors: * Pranav Salunke (dguitarbite) * Roger Luethi (rluethi) Work Items ---------- * The kickstart file needs some hacking. This file is not the default one used by osbash, since i.e. the machine needs "real" networking from the very beginning * The bridge network needs to be set on VirtualBox (or KVM) * Decide whether the install scripts on the target (OpenStack) machines (controller/compute) are going to be executed via ssh or upstart scripts after reboot * Set some MAC rules on the dhcp server, to avoid having to chose the machine to be installed, and enable full automation of the process Testing ======= Run: ./osbash.sh -b pxeserver The machine will be accessible in subnet of the bridged interface with the last octet being ``100``. If we are using the default networks, this could be ``10.0.0.100``. The login credentials are the default ones for osbash. References ========== * The boot menu for the PXE provision is similar to the one in BOMSI: https://github.com/julenl/BOMSI/tree/master/Ubuntu-Liberty

commit_message:
Re-license charm as Apache-2.0

All contributors to this charm have agreed to the switch
from GPL v3 to Apache 2.0; switch to Apache-2.0 license
as agreed so we can move forward with official project status.

Change-Id: Iaee75f59fe51f01da18aa2703a46c3885ade73c0

commit_message:
Remove sysctl element from overcloud image

We moved sysctl management under puppet and the old key
providing sysctl settings to os-apply-config is empty so this
change removes the element from the overcloud image.

  # os-apply-config --key sysctl --type raw --key-default ''
  #

Depends-On: I197eb6825b6e7dbc03640cdb16ea160dd83f7adb
Change-Id: Ic920d8f172f98a12a58035276815a41fe0654f4e

commit_message:
OpenStack reliability test plan

This document describes a abstract methodology for analysing
reliability of high-availability OpenStack cluster and it's components.

Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelia <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I5a08c1a39bab96d90c6f7a873fdc771516ffba48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/performance-docs refs/changes/98/326598/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _reliability_testing: ============================= OpenStack reliability testing ============================= :status: draft :version: 0 :Abstract: This document describes a abstract methodology for analysing reliability of high-availability OpenStack cluster and it's components. :Conventions: - **OpenStack cluster:** consist a set of server nodes with deployed and fully operational OpenStack environment in high-availability topology. - **Fault-injection operation:** We describe five types of faults: service-hang, service-crash, network-partition, network-flapping and node-crash - **Service-hang:** faults are injected into specified OpenStack service by sending -SIGSTOP and -SIGCONT POSIX signals. - **Service-crash:** faults are injected by sending -SIGKILL signal into specified OpenStack service. - **Node-crash:** faults are injected into OpenStack cluster by rebooting or shutdowning server node. - **Network-partition:** faults are injected by inserting iptables rules to OpenStack cluster nodes to corresponding service that should be network-partitioned. - **Network-flapping:** faults are injected into Openstack cluster nodes by on-fly inserting/deleting iptables rules to corresponding service that should be tested. - **Factor:** consist a set of atomic fault-injection operations. Example: reboot-random-controller, reboot-master-mq-controller etc - **Test plan:** Test plan should contain two elements: test scenario execution graph, fault-injection factors. - **MTTR:** Mean Time To Repair - **SLA:** Service Level Agreement Test Plan ========= OpenStack cluster description ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ This section should contain all information about deployed OpenStack environment including archive with all information in /etc folder from all nodes. Environment description ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This section should contain all cluster hardware information, including processor model and frequency, memory size, storage type and capacity, networking interfaces, etc. A separate client node must be used to drive the tests. Hardware ~~~~~~~~ This section should contains full hardware nodes specification. .. table:: Description of server hardware +-------+----------------+-------+-------+ |server |name | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |role | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |vendor,model | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |operating_system| | | +-------+----------------+-------+-------+ |CPU |vendor,model | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |processor_count | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |core_count | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |frequency_MHz | | | +-------+----------------+-------+-------+ |RAM |vendor,model | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |amount_MB | | | +-------+----------------+-------+-------+ |NETWORK|interface_name | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |vendor,model | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |bandwidth | | | +-------+----------------+-------+-------+ |STORAGE|dev_name | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |vendor,model | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |SSD/HDD | | | | +----------------+-------+-------+ | |size | | | +-------+----------------+-------+-------+ Networking ~~~~~~~~~~ This section should сontain full description of network equipment used in OpenStack cluster. Network topology diagram and network hardware configuration files should be included in this section. Cluster preparation ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ This section should contain all steps to reproduce Openstack environment deployment. For example: if testing environment deployed with Devstack, this section should contain all devstack configuration files, devstack version and all deployment steps. Client preparation ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ This section should contain all steps to reproduce deployment of client node including versions of all testing software tools, such as Rally or Tempest etc Example factors ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ - **reboot-random-controller:** consist node-crash fault injection at random OpenStack controller node. - **reboot-master-rabbitmq:** consist node-crash fault injection at master RabbitMQ messaging node. - **reboot-random-slave-rabbitmq:** consist node-crash fault injection at random RabbitMQ messaging node. - **sigstop-random-nova-api:** consist service-hang fault injection at random nova-api service. Example test cases: ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Example test case 1: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Rally NovaServers.boot_and_delete_server scenario (constant runner, concurrency 5) .. table:: +----------------------------------+------------------+---------------------+--------------------+--------------+--------+---------+ | Factor | Total iterations | Injection-iteration | Success iterations | Failure rate | MTTR | SLA | +----------------------------------+------------------+---------------------+--------------------+--------------+--------+---------+ | reboot-random-controller | 50 | 10 | 45 | 10% | 10 sec | Failure | +----------------------------------+------------------+---------------------+--------------------+--------------+--------+---------+ | reboot-master-rabbitmq | 50 | 10 | 30 | 40% | 25 sec | Failure | +----------------------------------+------------------+---------------------+--------------------+--------------+--------+---------+ | reboot-random-slave-rabbitmq | 50 | 10 | 50 | 0% | 0 sec | Success | +----------------------------------+------------------+---------------------+--------------------+--------------+--------+---------+ | sigstop-random-nova-api | 50 | 10 | 49 | 0.2% | 1 sec | Success | +----------------------------------+------------------+---------------------+--------------------+--------------+--------+---------+ Example test case 2: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Rally GlanceImages.create_and_delete_image scenario (constant runner, concurrency 5) .. table:: +----------------------------------+------------------+---------------------+--------------------+--------------+--------+---------+ | Factor | Total iterations | Injection-iteration | Success iterations | Failure rate | MTTR | SLA | +----------------------------------+------------------+---------------------+--------------------+--------------+--------+---------+ | reboot-random-controller | 50 | 10 | 50 | 0% | 0 sec | Success | +----------------------------------+------------------+---------------------+--------------------+--------------+--------+---------+ | reboot-master-rabbitmq | 50 | 10 | 45 | 10% | 5 sec | Failure | +----------------------------------+------------------+---------------------+--------------------+--------------+--------+---------+ | reboot-random-slave-rabbitmq | 50 | 10 | 50 | 0% | 0 sec | Success | +----------------------------------+------------------+---------------------+--------------------+--------------+--------+---------+

commit_message:
Ensure reading default group nas_secure_file_* settings in Quobyte

The Quobyte driver currently reads nas_secure_file_* settings from
the 'Quobyte' group but not the default group where these are
configured. This change explicitely fetches the values from the
default group of the configuration.
Closes-Bug: #1597660

Change-Id: I7ceb617dac1739de513e1f3772c7cb1c9e001089
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/73/335873/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONF.nas_secure_file_operations = "false" CONF.nas_secure_file_permissions = "false" CONF.nas_secure_file_operations = "true" CONF.nas_secure_file_permissions = "true"

Fix the wrong check of X-PROJECT-ID

v2 should require project id as well.

APIimpact

Change-Id: I2beaad5ff920fa1c82d48603b74f93229bb8d706

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-07-04 00:08+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-07-04 05:56+0000\n"msgid "Add LBaaS panels to Dashboard" msgstr "ダッシュボードへの LBaaS パネルの追加""matches the installed version of Dashboard:""openstack/neutron-lbaas-dashboard/>`__ をクローンし、インストールされている" "ダッシュボードのバージョンに合致するリリースブランチをチェックアウトします。""``neutron-lbaas-dashboard/enabled`` directory into the Dashboard " "``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled`` directory.""``_1481_project_ng_loadbalancersv2_panel.py`` ファイルをダッシュボードの " "``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled`` ディレクトリーにコピーします。""Enable the plug-in in Dashboard by editing the ``local_settings.py`` file " "and setting ``enable_lb`` to ``True`` in the ``OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK`` ""``enable_lb`` を ``True`` にすることで、ダッシュボードでこのプラグインを有効" "化します。""If Dashboard is configured to compress static files for better performance " "(usually set through ``COMPRESS_OFFLINE`` in ``local_settings.py``), " "optimize the static files again:""性能向上のため、ダッシュボードが静的ファイルを圧縮するように設定されている場" "合 (通常は ``local_settings.py`` の ``COMPRESS_OFFLIME`` により設定されま" "す)、静的ファイルの最適化をもう一度行います。"msgid "Install the Dashboard panel plug-in:" msgstr "ダッシュボードパネルのプラグインをインストールします。"msgid "" "Make sure that subnets on an external network are created from the subnet " "pools created above:" msgstr "" "外部ネットワークのサブネットは、上記で作成したサブネットプールから作成してく" "ださい。" "The Dashboard panels for managing LBaaS v2 are available starting with the " "Mitaka release." msgstr "" "Mitaka リリース以降では、 LBaaSv2 を管理するためのダッシュボードパネルが利用" "できます。" msgid """This step ensures that Dashboard can find the plug-in when it enumerates all " "of its available panels." msgstr "" "この手順を行うことで、ダッシュボードが利用可能なパネルを探す際に LBaaSv2 プラ" "グインを認識するようになります。" msgid """To find the panel, click on :guilabel:`Project` in Dashboard, then click " "the :guilabel:`Network` drop-down menu and select :guilabel:`Load Balancers`.""このパネルを開くには、 ダッシュボードの :guilabel:`プロジェクト` 、 :" "guilabel:`ネットワーク` ドロップダウンメニューをクリックし、 :guilabel:`ロー" "ドバランサー` を選択します。"
deleted_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-07-03 02:33+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-07-02 04:03+0000\n"msgid "Add LBaaS panels in Horizon" msgstr "Horizon への LBaaS パネルの追加""matches the installed version of Horizon:""openstack/neutron-lbaas-dashboard/>`__ をクローンし、インストールされている " "Horizon のバージョンに合致するリリースブランチをチェックアウトします。""``neutron-lbaas-dashboard/enabled`` directory into Horizon's " "``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled`` directory. This step ensures that " "Horizon can find the plugin when it enumerates all of its available panels.""``_1481_project_ng_loadbalancersv2_panel.py`` ファイルを Horizon の " "``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled`` ディレクトリーにコピーします。この手順" "を行うことで、 Horizon が利用可能なパネルを探す際に LBaaSv2 プラグインを認識" "するようになります。""Enable the plugin in Horizon by editing the ``local_settings.py`` file and " "setting ``enable_lb`` to ``True`` in the ``OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK`` ""``enable_lb`` を ``True`` にすることで、 Horizon でこのプラグインを有効化しま" "す。"msgid "" "Horizon panels for managing LBaaSv2 are available starting with the Mitaka " "release." msgstr "" "Mitaka リリース以降では、 LBaaSv2 を管理するための Horizon パネルが利用できま" "す。" "If Horizon is configured to compress static files for better performance " "(usually set via ``COMPRESS_OFFLINE`` in the ``local_settings.py``), the " "static files must be optimized again:""性能向上のため Horizon が静的ファイルを圧縮するように設定されている場合 (通常" "は ``local_settings.py`` の ``COMPRESS_OFFLIME`` により設定されます)、 静的" "ファイルの最適化をもう一度行う必要があります。"msgid "Install the Horizon panel plugin:" msgstr "Horizon パネルのプラグインをインストールします。""To find the panel, click on :guilabel:`Project` in Horizon, then click the :" "guilabel:`Network` drop down, and click :guilabel:`Load Balancers`.""このパネルを開くには、 Horizon の :guilabel:`プロジェクト` 、 :guilabel:`ネッ" "トワーク` ドロップダウン、 :guilabel:`ロードバランサー` を順にクリックしま" "す。"

commit_message:
Fix xrange py3 compatible

In py3, xrange is renamed to range,
so it needs to be modified to make it compatible.

Closes-Bug: #1596127

Change-Id: I4e4985f7ec7558b7293b08e7a90de60e2717a708

commit_message:
Default ceph_osd_selinux_permissive to false

We don't set selinux in 'permissive' mode by default anymore.

Change-Id: I1aa46086f69e7c3efd2782da62fd18ade8343fde
Partial-Bug: 1595518

added_lines: # Default to false $ceph_osd_selinux_permissive = false, class { '::tripleo::selinux': mode => 'permissive',
deleted_lines: # Default to true $ceph_osd_selinux_permissive = true, exec { 'set selinux to permissive on boot': command => "sed -ie 's/^SELINUX=.*/SELINUX=permissive/' /etc/selinux/config", onlyif => "test -f /etc/selinux/config && ! grep '^SELINUX=permissive' /etc/selinux/config", path => ['/usr/bin', '/usr/sbin'], } exec { 'set selinux to permissive': command => 'setenforce 0', onlyif => "which setenforce && getenforce | grep -i 'enforcing'", path => ['/usr/bin', '/usr/sbin'],

commit_message:
Stop no-opping PackageUpdate on upgrade

After we fixed bug #1567384 and bug #1567385, we no longer need to no-op
the PakageUpdate resource on upgrades. I removed the no-op in change
Ie14ddbff15e7ed21aaa3fcdacf36e0040f912382 from
major-upgrade-pacemaker-converge.yaml but didn't recall we had the no-op
in major-upgrade-pacemaker{,-init}.yaml too.

Change-Id: I24b913c790eae79e3b207729e0b22378075fb282
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/35/336535/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make xrange py3 compatible

In py3 ,
Xrange is renamed to range,
so it needs to be modified to make it compatible.
the code:
print (xrange(5))
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "code", line 4, in <module>
    print (xrange(5))
NameError: name 'xrange' is not defined.

Change-Id: I3a0e22876c35ced5c961c092fcda25db33d1c599
Closes-Bug: #1596127

commit_message:
Remove sysctl element from overcloud image

We moved sysctl management under puppet and the old key
providing sysctl settings to os-apply-config is empty so this change
removes the element from the overcloud image.

  # os-apply-config --key sysctl --type raw --key-default ''
  #

Change-Id: I197eb6825b6e7dbc03640cdb16ea160dd83f7adb

commit_message:
Don't cache and re-use the websocket

The socket is bound to the queue name and this this removes the
ability to work with multiple queues and if the websocket it
closed it can't be easily recreated.

Change-Id: I6d05b9536111a77a54b818dcf1a9d030ad464e7f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/85/331985/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The second access should not return the same client: self.assertIsNot(client.messaging_websocket(), websocket) self.assertEqual(clientmgr.auth.get_token.call_count, 2) self.assertEqual(clientmgr.get_endpoint_for_service_type.call_count, 2) ws_create_connection.assert_called_with("ws://0.0.0.0")
deleted_lines: # The second access should return the same client: self.assertIs(client.messaging_websocket(), websocket) self.assertEqual(clientmgr.auth.get_token.call_count, 1) self.assertEqual(clientmgr.get_endpoint_for_service_type.call_count, 1) ws_create_connection.assert_called_once_with("ws://0.0.0.0")

subject: Remove fuel-mirror project from Fuel
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 10:40:21.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/4501084f32e49e4d3a35d0299cfb395cf761e5df', 'message': 'Remove fuel-mirror project from Fuel

Instead of fuel-mirror it is recommended to use Packetary to create
partial repository mirrors and use Python-fuelclient
to manage Fuel metadata. Fuel-mirror is going to be deprecated.

commit_message:
Remove fuel-mirror project from Fuel

Instead of fuel-mirror it is recommended to use Packetary to create
partial repository mirrors and use Python-fuelclient
to manage Fuel metadata. Fuel-mirror is going to be deprecated.

Change-Id: If657de5bc298649adabe5124c205668f6ed51f80

commit_message:
Create puppet-openstack_infra_spec_helper repo

This is a ruby gem that holds dependencies for other infra puppet
modules, allowing us to change one thing in one place instead of many
places.

Change-Id: I2dc35841b13b886753314a31adf0254590279451
Depends-On: I2eaa81a06d061d4ef65a8b717961de446dce9c8a

commit_message:
Added stable:follows-policy for neutron-dynamic-routing

The repo was created by moving the code from core neutron repo in Newton
time frame. Even while the repo does not have a single stable branch
yet, The feature still follows stable policy by cherry-picking relevant
fixes into neutron core repo stable/mitaka branch. The same stable team
oversights those backports and follows the exact same practices as for
any other neutron backports.

With that in mind, I think it's fair to add the tag to the new
deliverable as well.

The tag was already present on the deliverable till
I3e86210ffbeceec8783b58120367fb8cd8f162dc. This patch merely restores
it.

Change-Id: I5c374e76e63fac7396bbb7f03a628d6c782402c6

commit_message:
Log request-id for each api call

Added new private method to log request-id of each api call
for both SessionClient and HTTPClient. Already available
ks_logger and client_logger will be used for SessionClient
and HTTPClient respectively.

Change-Id: I679c57b96071ecd9bcd1ab2ed50692195586ca52
Implements: blueprint log-request-id

commit_message:
Add debug information for engine workflow

This patch adds debug information for some engine
workflows, like cluster_create, cluster_resize, etc.
These debug information will be helpful for operator
and developer to track the workflow executed inside
senlin-engine.
It also changes the log level of some existing debug
info from ERROR to DEBUG since they are actually for
errors like badrequest from enduser rather than
exceptions of senlin-engine itself.

Change-Id: I68f655cea382fbb5443a317260fc473040426e4e
Closes-Bug: #1592736

[WIP!!!] PoC for Glare lock + updates

Change-Id: Ibec9168e7b76b72bff4dfcba6b05919dfaf4a7a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/63/334463/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glance.glare import locking 'artifacts': {}, 'locks': {}class SimpleAPI(api.BaseDBAPI, locking.LockApiMixin): def create_exclusive_write_lock(self, context, item_id, lock_scope): global DATA item_lock = DATA['locks'].get(item_id) if item_lock: # raise Conflict here pass else: DATA['locks'][item_id][lock_scope] = { 'type': 'exclusive_write' } return lock_scope def create_shared_write_lock(self, context, item_id, lock_scope): global DATA item_lock = DATA['locks'].get(item_id) if item_lock: lock_id = lock_scope if item_lock['type'] == 'exclusive_write' \ or lock_scope in item_lock['scope']: # TODO (kairat) raise Conflict here pass else: if item_lock: DATA['locks'][item_id]['scope'].append(lock_scope) else: DATA['locks'][item_id] = { 'type': 'shared_write', 'scope': [lock_scope] } return item_id def release(self, context, item_id, lock_id): global DATA item_locks = DATA['locks']['item_id'] if item_locks: if item_lock['type'] == 'exclusive_write': del DATA['locks'][lock_id] else: DATA['locks'][lock_id]['scope'].remove()

commit_message:
Added filter operators

In this changeset, I refactored the DB filter system to support
comparison operators using a django-like syntax.
A filter can take 2 forms:

- "<FIELDNAME>" which is a syntactic sugar for "<FIELDNAME>__eq"
- "<FIELDNAME>__<OPERATOR>" where <OPERATOR> is the comparison operator
  to be used.

Here is the list of the supported operators:

- 'eq' (==)
- 'neq' (!=)
- 'gt' (>)
- 'gte' (>=)
- 'lt' (<)
- 'lte' (<=)
- 'in' (in)
- 'notin' (not in)

Change-Id: I53a61d50a3253342a40f0ff87cb5612ed57a3bd1

Added the Apache 2 headers to the jclouds code samples

The JClouds samples submitted so far in the firstapp book
do not have needed Apache 2.0 headers. This commit fixes
that.

added_lines: def get_policy_table_schema(client, policy_name, table_name, number_of_cols): rules = client.list_policy_rules(policy_name)['results'] column_names = [] for rule in rules: rule_def = rule['rule'] head, _ = rule_def.split(':-') if head.strip().startswith('%s(' % table_name): start = head.index('(') + 1 end = head.index(')') column_names = head[start:end].split(',') if len(column_names) == number_of_cols: break else: column_names = [] continue cols = [name.strip() for name in column_names] return cols ncols = len(results[0]['data']) #columns = [] #if results: # columns = ['Col%s' % (i) # for i in range(0, len(results[0]['data']))] columns = get_policy_table_schema(client, parsed_args.policy_name, parsed_args.table, ncols) def _get_schema_policy_table(self, policy_name, table_name): client = self.app.client_manager.congressclient rules = client.list_policy_rules(policy_name)['results'] # There might be multiple rules that use the same name in the head. Pick # the first matching one, which is what the policy engine currently does. for rule in rules: rule_def = rule['rule'] head, _ = rule_def.split(RULE_SEPARATOR) if head.strip().startswith('%s(' % table_name): start = head.index('(') + 1 end = head.index(')') column_names = head[start:end].split(',') break schema = {'table_id': table_name} schema['columns'] = [name.strip() for name in column_names] return schema['columns']

commit_message:
Add a testcase for TestBaremetalShow

The method openstackclient.common.utils.find_resource()
called by take_action() is likely to raise an exception
while an unexisting node specified.
This patch tries to add a testcase to cover this case.

commit_message:
Add a testcase for TestBaremetalDelete

The method openstackclient.common.utils.find_resource()
called by take_action() is likely to raise an exception
while an unexisting node specified.
This patch tries to add a testcase to cover this case.

Change-Id: I005190c022e308cb9799224ab20e820268d4089a

commit_message:
Add a node validation for the osc command "baremetal set/unset"

The "baremetal set/unset" command should make sure the node exists
before doing their own jobs.

Change-Id: I0cc5ee701400b5f90a9e475b2f1abcbd317250fd

commit_message:
Raise the major version of psutil

psutil is infrequently used, and mainly for agent projects like
heat-cfntools.

The reason for this change is to allow this os-refresh-config change
to call the Process.children method
Ibcbb2090aed126abec8dac49efa53ecbdb2b9b2c

The last 1.x release was 2013-11-25. 2.2.1 is available in the
following repositories making it a more appropriate version to test
against:
- EPEL 7
- Fedora 23 onwards
- Ubuntu Wily onwards

Change-Id: If31f0d5d60e8585720c4c9c95cffa202f059f6f7

commit_message:
Add related parameters to nova::api class

This patch is aim to add following params in nova::api class
- metadata_cache_expiration
- vendordata_jsonfile_path
- osapi_max_limit
- osapi_compute_link_prefix
- osapi_glance_link_prefix

Change-Id: Ib3f3d9b7d8874c235c9a90dc392a7cf436c0154c
Closes-Bug: #1597988
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/70/336370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*metadata_cache_expiration*] # (optional) This option is the time (in seconds) to cache metadata. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*vendordata_jsonfile_path*] # (optional) Represent the path to the data file. # Cloud providers may store custom data in vendor data file that will then be # available to the instances via the metadata service, and to the rendering of # config-drive. The default class for this, JsonFileVendorData, loads this # information from a JSON file, whose path is configured by this option # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*osapi_max_limit*] # (optional) This option is limit the maximum number of items in a single response. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*osapi_compute_link_prefix*] # (optional) This string is prepended to the normal URL that is returned in links # to the OpenStack Compute API. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*osapi_glance_link_prefix*] # (optional) This string is prepended to the normal URL that is returned in links # to Glance resources. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $metadata_cache_expiration = $::os_service_default, $vendordata_jsonfile_path = $::os_service_default, $osapi_max_limit = $::os_service_default, $osapi_compute_link_prefix = $::os_service_default, $osapi_glance_link_prefix = $::os_service_default, 'DEFAULT/metadata_cache_expiration': value => $metadata_cache_expiration; 'DEFAULT/vendordata_jsonfile_path': value => $vendordata_jsonfile_path; 'DEFAULT/osapi_max_limit': value => $osapi_max_limit; 'DEFAULT/osapi_compute_link_prefix': value => $osapi_compute_link_prefix; 'DEFAULT/osapi_glance_link_prefix': value => $osapi_glance_link_prefix;

commit_message:
Remove deprecated method iso8601_from_timestamp from oslo.utils

The method iso8601_from_timestamp was deprecated for removal in
version 1.6 of oslo.utils and will remove it in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252898/. This commit replaces
its usage.

Change-Id: I573b08f4ff7315b0f96aa12598b1f5a5b9443830

commit_message:
Use osc_lib instead of cliff

Base classes of commands are defined in cliff,
but have been encapsulated again in osc-lib for
all plugin clients. So use osc-lib instead of
cliff.

Change-Id: I7b64c4dbedf270720f222471d57b9e20ab5a046c

commit_message:
Remove mox from nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_volumeops.py

Replace mox.stubOutWithMock() with mock.patch

Part of blueprint remove-mox-newton

Change-Id: Id11ffe107e175c1b55048a00a1549dccd4059332
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/65/322665/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(volumeops.vm_utils, "lookup") @mock.patch.object(volumeops.vm_utils, "is_vm_shutdown") @mock.patch.object(volumeops.vm_utils, "unplug_vbd") @mock.patch.object(volumeops.vm_utils, "destroy_vbd") @mock.patch.object(volumeops.volume_utils, "find_vbd_by_number") @mock.patch.object(volumeops.volume_utils, "get_device_number") @mock.patch.object(volumeops.volume_utils, "find_sr_from_vbd") @mock.patch.object(volumeops.volume_utils, "purge_sr") def test_detach_volume_call(self, mock_purge_sr, mock_find_sr, mock_get_device, mock_find_vdb, mock_destroy_vdb, mock_unplug_vdb, mock_is_vm_shutdown, mock_lookup): def regcall(label, ret_value=None): return ret_value mock_lookup.return_value = 'vmref' mock_get_device.return_value = 'devnumber' mock_find_vdb.return_value = 'vbdref' mock_is_vm_shutdown.return_value = False mock_destroy_vdb.side_effect = regcall('destroy_vbd') mock_find_sr.side_effect = regcall('find_sr_from_vbd', 'srref') mock_lookup.assert_called_once_with('session', 'instance_1') mock_get_device.assert_called_once_with('mountpoint') mock_find_vdb.assert_called_once_with('session', 'vmref', 'devnumber') mock_is_vm_shutdown.assert_called_once_with('session', 'vmref') mock_unplug_vdb.assert_called_once_with('session', 'vbdref', 'vmref') mock_destroy_vdb.assert_called_once_with('session', 'vbdref') mock_find_sr.assert_called_once_with('session', 'vbdref') mock_purge_sr.assert_called_once_with('session', 'srref')
deleted_lines: def test_detach_volume_call(self): def regcall(label): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(volumeops.vm_utils, 'lookup') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(volumeops.volume_utils, 'find_vbd_by_number') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(volumeops.vm_utils, 'is_vm_shutdown') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(volumeops.vm_utils, 'unplug_vbd') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(volumeops.vm_utils, 'destroy_vbd') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(volumeops.volume_utils, 'get_device_number') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(volumeops.volume_utils, 'find_sr_from_vbd') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(volumeops.volume_utils, 'purge_sr') volumeops.vm_utils.lookup('session', 'instance_1').AndReturn( 'vmref') volumeops.volume_utils.get_device_number('mountpoint').AndReturn( 'devnumber') volumeops.volume_utils.find_vbd_by_number( 'session', 'vmref', 'devnumber').AndReturn('vbdref') volumeops.vm_utils.is_vm_shutdown('session', 'vmref').AndReturn( False) volumeops.vm_utils.unplug_vbd('session', 'vbdref', 'vmref') volumeops.vm_utils.destroy_vbd('session', 'vbdref').WithSideEffects( regcall('destroy_vbd')) volumeops.volume_utils.find_sr_from_vbd( 'session', 'vbdref').WithSideEffects( regcall('find_sr_from_vbd')).AndReturn('srref') volumeops.volume_utils.purge_sr('session', 'srref') self.mox.ReplayAll()

commit_message:
test_quotas should always use newly created tenant

This is to make test_compare_tenant_quotas_with_default_quotas
always use newly created tenant to ensure the tenant's quota set
will be equal to default quota set.

Change-Id: Ic6e0b00fa2d9924e94919277b22edeb70b543f2b
Closes-Bug: #1582562

commit_message:
Fix typos for Magnum

1. greethread  --> greenthread
2. reschduling --> rescheduling
3. technolgies --> technologies
4. montior     --> monitor
5. avaiable    --> available
6. autoscaling --> auto scaling
7. Asynchrnous --> Asynchronous
8. Availablity--> Availability

Change-Id: I94e2e4eeacb72f029754382142696150ffee72ef

commit_message:
Add bonding support to bifrost

Add vars and inventory definitions for defining bonded interfaces. There
is no support added for this when using ironic as the inventory source.

Change-Id: I9c83f87462fd41181276c036cf432a3753ce7611
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/69/316169/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[config-ref] Add database configuration to common

This patch imports database content from nova as first step.
I will check and update the configuration options
for all service on the following patch.

Change-Id: I7beba01709d8efe6791bdf8d0bfa64570edf2c2c
Implements: blueprint config-ref-common-sections

added_lines: ====================== Database configuration ====================== You can configure OpenStack Compute to use any SQLAlchemy-compatible database. To ensure that the database schema is current, run the following command: .. code-block:: console # SERVICE-manage db sync To configure the connection string for the database, use the configuration option settings documented in the table :ref:`common-database`. .. include:: ../tables/common-database.rst

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-07-03 02:21+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-07-02 05:39+0000\n"msgid "Add LBaaS panels in Horizon" msgstr "Horizon への LBaaS パネルの追加" msgid "" "Copy the ``_1481_project_ng_loadbalancersv2_panel.py`` file from the " "``neutron-lbaas-dashboard/enabled`` directory into Horizon's " "``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled`` directory. This step ensures that " "Horizon can find the plugin when it enumerates all of its available panels." msgstr "" "``neutron-lbaas-dashboard/enabled`` ディレクトリーの " "``_1481_project_ng_loadbalancersv2_panel.py`` ファイルを Horizon の " "``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled`` ディレクトリーにコピーします。この手順" "を行うことで、 Horizon が利用可能なパネルを探す際に LBaaSv2 プラグインを認識" "するようになります。" msgid "" "Enable the plugin in Horizon by editing the ``local_settings.py`` file and " "setting ``enable_lb`` to ``True`` in the ``OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK`` " "dictionary." msgstr "" "``local_settings.py`` ファイルを編集し、 ``OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK`` の " "``enable_lb`` を ``True`` にすることで、 Horizon でこのプラグインを有効化しま" "す。" msgid "" "Horizon panels for managing LBaaSv2 are available starting with the Mitaka " "release." msgstr "" "Mitaka リリース以降では、 LBaaSv2 を管理するための Horizon パネルが利用できま" "す。" "If Horizon is configured to compress static files for better performance " "(usually set via ``COMPRESS_OFFLINE`` in the ``local_settings.py``), the " "static files must be optimized again:" msgstr "" "性能向上のため Horizon が静的ファイルを圧縮するように設定されている場合 (通常" "は ``local_settings.py`` の ``COMPRESS_OFFLIME`` により設定されます)、 静的" "ファイルの最適化をもう一度行う必要があります。" msgid ""msgid "Install the Horizon panel plugin:" msgstr "Horizon パネルのプラグインをインストールします。" msgid "Restart Apache to activate the new panel:" msgstr "Apache を再起動して、新しいパネルを有効にします。" "To find the panel, click on :guilabel:`Project` in Horizon, then click the :" "guilabel:`Network` drop down, and click :guilabel:`Load Balancers`." msgstr "" "このパネルを開くには、 Horizon の :guilabel:`プロジェクト` 、 :guilabel:`ネッ" "トワーク` ドロップダウン、 :guilabel:`ロードバランサー` を順にクリックしま" "す。" msgid ""

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/98/336898/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Warning: Do not edit this file. It is automatically generated from the software project's code and your changes will be overwritten. The tool to generate this file lives in openstack-doc-tools repository. Please make any changes needed in the code, then run the autogenerate-config-doc tool from the openstack-doc-tools repository, or ask for help on the documentation mailing list, IRC channel or meeting. .. _common-auth_token: .. list-table:: Description of authorization token configuration options :header-rows: 1 :class: config-ref-table * - Configuration option = Default value - Description * - **[keystone_authtoken]** - * - ``admin_password`` = ``None`` - (String) Service user password. * - ``admin_tenant_name`` = ``admin`` - (String) Service tenant name. * - ``admin_token`` = ``None`` - (String) This option is deprecated and may be removed in a future release. Single shared secret with the Keystone configuration used for bootstrapping a Keystone installation, or otherwise bypassing the normal authentication process. This option should not be used, use `admin_user` and `admin_password` instead. * - ``admin_user`` = ``None`` - (String) Service username. * - ``auth_admin_prefix`` = - (String) Prefix to prepend at the beginning of the path. Deprecated, use identity_uri. * - ``auth_host`` = ``127.0.0.1`` - (String) Host providing the admin Identity API endpoint. Deprecated, use identity_uri. * - ``auth_port`` = ``35357`` - (Integer) Port of the admin Identity API endpoint. Deprecated, use identity_uri. * - ``auth_protocol`` = ``https`` - (String) Protocol of the admin Identity API endpoint. Deprecated, use identity_uri. * - ``auth_section`` = ``None`` - (Unknown) Config Section from which to load plugin specific options * - ``auth_type`` = ``None`` - (Unknown) Authentication type to load * - ``auth_uri`` = ``None`` - (String) Complete public Identity API endpoint. * - ``auth_version`` = ``None`` - (String) API version of the admin Identity API endpoint. * - ``cache`` = ``None`` - (String) Env key for the swift cache. * - ``cafile`` = ``None`` - (String) A PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs connections. Defaults to system CAs. * - ``certfile`` = ``None`` - (String) Required if identity server requires client certificate * - ``check_revocations_for_cached`` = ``False`` - (Boolean) If true, the revocation list will be checked for cached tokens. This requires that PKI tokens are configured on the identity server. * - ``delay_auth_decision`` = ``False`` - (Boolean) Do not handle authorization requests within the middleware, but delegate the authorization decision to downstream WSGI components. * - ``enforce_token_bind`` = ``permissive`` - (String) Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be set to: "disabled" to not check token binding. "permissive" (default) to validate binding information if the bind type is of a form known to the server and ignore it if not. "strict" like "permissive" but if the bind type is unknown the token will be rejected. "required" any form of token binding is needed to be allowed. Finally the name of a binding method that must be present in tokens. * - ``hash_algorithms`` = ``md5`` - (List) Hash algorithms to use for hashing PKI tokens. This may be a single algorithm or multiple. The algorithms are those supported by Python standard hashlib.new(). The hashes will be tried in the order given, so put the preferred one first for performance. The result of the first hash will be stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only while migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more secure one. Once all the old tokens are expired this option should be set to a single value for better performance. * - ``http_connect_timeout`` = ``None`` - (Integer) Request timeout value for communicating with Identity API server. * - ``http_request_max_retries`` = ``3`` - (Integer) How many times are we trying to reconnect when communicating with Identity API Server. * - ``identity_uri`` = ``None`` - (String) Complete admin Identity API endpoint. This should specify the unversioned root endpoint e.g. https://localhost:35357/ * - ``include_service_catalog`` = ``True`` - (Boolean) (Optional) Indicate whether to set the X-Service-Catalog header. If False, middleware will not ask for service catalog on token validation and will not set the X-Service-Catalog header. * - ``insecure`` = ``False`` - (Boolean) Verify HTTPS connections. * - ``keyfile`` = ``None`` - (String) Required if identity server requires client certificate * - ``memcache_pool_conn_get_timeout`` = ``10`` - (Integer) (Optional) Number of seconds that an operation will wait to get a memcached client connection from the pool. * - ``memcache_pool_dead_retry`` = ``300`` - (Integer) (Optional) Number of seconds memcached server is considered dead before it is tried again. * - ``memcache_pool_maxsize`` = ``10`` - (Integer) (Optional) Maximum total number of open connections to every memcached server. * - ``memcache_pool_socket_timeout`` = ``3`` - (Integer) (Optional) Socket timeout in seconds for communicating with a memcached server. * - ``memcache_pool_unused_timeout`` = ``60`` - (Integer) (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in the pool before it is closed. * - ``memcache_secret_key`` = ``None`` - (String) (Optional, mandatory if memcache_security_strategy is defined) This string is used for key derivation. * - ``memcache_security_strategy`` = ``None`` - (String) (Optional) If defined, indicate whether token data should be authenticated or authenticated and encrypted. If MAC, token data is authenticated (with HMAC) in the cache. If ENCRYPT, token data is encrypted and authenticated in the cache. If the value is not one of these options or empty, auth_token will raise an exception on initialization. * - ``memcache_use_advanced_pool`` = ``False`` - (Boolean) (Optional) Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. The advanced pool will only work under python 2.x. * - ``region_name`` = ``None`` - (String) The region in which the identity server can be found. * - ``revocation_cache_time`` = ``10`` - (Integer) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly reduce performance. * - ``signing_dir`` = ``None`` - (String) Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens. * - ``token_cache_time`` = ``300`` - (Integer) In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, the middleware caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration (in seconds). Set to -1 to disable caching completely.

added_lines: # Fails on the 8th retry for a max of 181s (~3min) before total # failure. @@request_timeout = 170 raise Puppet::ExecutionFailure, "Command: 'openstack #{args.inspect}' has been running for more then #{command_timeout(action)} seconds" start_time = current_time retry_count = 0 if current_time > end_time error_message = exception.message error_message += " (tried #{retry_count}, for a total of #{end_time - start_time } seconds)" raise(Puppet::ExecutionFailure, error_message) end raise exception if no_retry_actions.include? action retry_count += 1
deleted_lines: @@request_timeout = 60 raise Puppet::ExecutionFailure, "Command: 'openstack #{args.inspect}' has been running for more then #{command_timeout} seconds!" raise exception if current_time > end_time

commit_message:
OVS: UnboundLocalError on switch timeout fixed

In case there is some cached datapath id in OVSAgentBridge
and openflow switch does not respond in time for some
reason, a call to OVSAgentBridge._dpid() method will result
in UnboundLocalError.
This patch addresses the issue by calculating dpid_str
value from cached dpid instead of referencing unassigned
variable.
Some minor refactor also took place.

Closes-Bug: #1588042

Change-Id: If50183bf95cbe50c3a2393be8c2ab913c9715a10

commit_message:
Deprecate defining c-vol backends in DEFAULT

We will, in future releases, remove support for this. For
now we will log a big warning when someone uses c-vol without
an enabled_backends config set.

DocImpact: Need to document upgrade path and new
recommended config.
Implements: blueprint shared-backend-config

Change-Id: Idf0a7346ae5d5ae45f9fc05a526ef5d66b162a3f

commit_message:
Dell SC: Do not set High Availability in async mode.

The Dell SC driver was setting replication SyncMode to HighAvailability
even if the replication type was Asynchronous. This is not supported
on the platform.

Change-Id: I209b70e7bca790e3fbb091fa5c11ec7aad4a2480
Closes-Bug: #1597820

commit_message:
One abnormal northbound event will be block the whole event queue

When exception occurs in processing northbound event, dragonflow will
loop forever to processing it, therefore can not process any other
events.

closes-bug: 1595829

Change-Id: I3756ffafb482f6e47792a363cab23af86ae7c303

Correct reraising of exception

Found an instance where an exception was being caught, then rethrown.
The correct handling would be to just raise again.

commit_message:
Take shared subnets into account for quotas

Previously, shared subnets were ignored by collecting used
networks; the "Create subnet" button is still enabled, but
subnet creation is forbidden by neutron due to quota reached.

Change-Id: I20b3373ab86631922945285a12ca4810b707b0be
Closes-Bug: #1588764

added_lines: subnets = neutron.subnet_list(request, shared=False) if tenant_id: subnets = [sub for sub in subnets if sub.tenant_id == tenant_id] # get shared subnets shared_subnets = neutron.subnet_list(request, shared=True) if tenant_id: shared_subnets = [subnet for subnet in shared_subnets if subnet.tenant_id == tenant_id] usages.tally('subnets', len(shared_subnets))

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: I9e3b8c8cb0e6df8f3b67ec9d4fc5bc5d25356d16
Closes-Bug: #1520036

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-17 13:22:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7e669a2fa45f16b420ce26eda27ecaafbb36b56a', 'message': "ml2: don't log exceptions that may be retried by API layer

Since Ia2d911a6a90b1baba1d5cc36f7c625e156a2bc33, we use version_id_col
SQLAlchemy feature to routinely bump revision numbers for resources.  By
doing so, SQLAlchemy also enforces the expected number on any UPDATE and
DELETE, which may not be valid when the transaction is actually applied.
In that case, the library will raise StaleDataError:

http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/exceptions.html#sqlalchemy.orm.exc.StaleDataError

The exception is then logged by ml2 and bubbles up to API layer where
retry mechanism will correctly catch it and issue another attempt.

If API layer does not retry on exception, it already logs the error,
including the traceback.

In ml2, it's too early to decide if an exception is worth being logged.
Plugin instead should just silently allow all unexpected exceptions to
bubble up and be dealt by API layer.

This patch disables the bare exception logging in the plugin.

Change-Id: I848df0aef5381e50dfb58e46d7a652113ac27a49
Closes-Bug: #1593719

Since Ia2d911a6a90b1baba1d5cc36f7c625e156a2bc33, we use version_id_col
SQLAlchemy feature to routinely bump revision numbers for resources.  By
doing so, SQLAlchemy also enforces the expected number on any UPDATE and
DELETE, which may not be valid when the transaction is actually applied.
In that case, the library will raise StaleDataError:

http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/exceptions.html#sqlalchemy.orm.exc.StaleDataError

The exception is then logged by ml2 and bubbles up to API layer where
retry mechanism will correctly catch it and issue another attempt.

If API layer does not retry on exception, it already logs the error,
including the traceback.

In ml2, it's too early to decide if an exception is worth being logged.
Plugin instead should just silently allow all unexpected exceptions to
bubble up and be dealt by API layer.

At the same time, there are some details that are known at the plugin
level only, that are not easily deducible from the API request details.
That's why we save details about the error on the exception object that
bubbles up into API layer, where we are ready to decide if those details
are worth being logged.

commit_message:
ml2: postpone exception logs to when retry mechanism fails to recover

Since Ia2d911a6a90b1baba1d5cc36f7c625e156a2bc33, we use version_id_col
SQLAlchemy feature to routinely bump revision numbers for resources.  By
doing so, SQLAlchemy also enforces the expected number on any UPDATE and
DELETE, which may not be valid when the transaction is actually applied.
In that case, the library will raise StaleDataError:

http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/exceptions.html#sqlalchemy.orm.exc.StaleDataError

The exception is then logged by ml2 and bubbles up to API layer where
retry mechanism will correctly catch it and issue another attempt.

If API layer does not retry on exception, it already logs the error,
including the traceback.

In ml2, it's too early to decide if an exception is worth being logged.
Plugin instead should just silently allow all unexpected exceptions to
bubble up and be dealt by API layer.

At the same time, there are some details that are known at the plugin
level only, that are not easily deducible from the API request details.
That's why we save details about the error on the exception object that
bubbles up into API layer, where we are ready to decide if those details
are worth being logged.

Change-Id: I848df0aef5381e50dfb58e46d7a652113ac27a49
Closes-Bug: #1593719

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/41/336541/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Add LBaaS panels to Dashboard ----------------------------- The Dashboard panels for managing LBaaSv2 are available starting with the Mitaka release. branch that matches the installed version of Dashboard:#. Install the Dashboard panel plug-in: ``neutron-lbaas-dashboard/enabled`` directory into the Dashboard ``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled`` directory. This step ensures that Dashboard can find the plug-in when it enumerates all of its available panels. #. Enable the plug-in in Dashboard by editing the ``local_settings.py`` file and setting ``enable_lb`` to ``True`` in the ``OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK``#. If Dashboard is configured to compress static files for better performance (usually set through ``COMPRESS_OFFLINE`` in ``local_settings.py``), optimize the static files again:To find the panel, click on :guilabel:`Project` in Dashboard, then click the :guilabel:`Network` drop-down menu and select :guilabel:`Load Balancers`.
deleted_lines: Add LBaaS panels in Horizon --------------------------- Horizon panels for managing LBaaSv2 are available starting with the Mitaka release. branch that matches the installed version of Horizon:#. Install the Horizon panel plugin: ``neutron-lbaas-dashboard/enabled`` directory into Horizon's ``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled`` directory. This step ensures that Horizon can find the plugin when it enumerates all of its available panels. #. Enable the plugin in Horizon by editing the ``local_settings.py`` file and setting ``enable_lb`` to ``True`` in the ``OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK``#. If Horizon is configured to compress static files for better performance (usually set via ``COMPRESS_OFFLINE`` in the ``local_settings.py``), the static files must be optimized again:To find the panel, click on :guilabel:`Project` in Horizon, then click the :guilabel:`Network` drop down, and click :guilabel:`Load Balancers`.

commit_message:
Skip non-doc checks for docs-only TripleO patches

This disables the following jobs for docs-only patches to
python-tripleoclient and tripleo-common:

 - gate-python-tripleoclient-python27
 - gate-python-tripleoclient-python34
 - gate-tripleo-common-python27
 - gate-tripleo-common-python34
 - gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-*

Change-Id: I5fd0374aabffa68eef44e33855b4b9143e5e7ff4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/49/336049/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Skip non-doc jobs for doc-only python-tripleoclient changes. Since documents # are checked by python-tripleoclient-pep8 it should not be skipped. - name: ^gate-(python-tripleoclient-(python27|python34|pypy)|tripleo-ci-centos-7-(upgrades|ha|nonha))$ skip-if: - project: ^openstack/python-tripleoclient$ all-files-match-any: - ^.*\.rst$ - ^doc/.*$

subject: Adopt to config_dir option being a list and not a string
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 14:27:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/etc/neutron_test2.conf.example', 'neutron/services/provider_configuration.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/test_provider_configuration.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/263a161fc0f9bf0a1f32c7019567be69c1e68a05', 'message': 'Adopt to config_dir option being a list and not a string

Since oslo.config 3.8.0 (that included
Ibd0566f11df62da031afb128c9687c5e8c7b27ae), config_dir option is a list,
not a string. While our custom provider configuration parser for
multistring options assumes the latter.

It makes all installations that 1) pass at least one --config-dir option
in CLI and 2) enable any service plugin that relies on provider
definitions, to fail to start neutron-server. For example, this affects
any RDO Mitaka installation with *aas service plugins enabled.

Since Newton requires >=3.9.0, we are fine to switch to the list type
without any code to support backwards compatibility with older option
type. For Mitaka backport, we will need to handle both cases.

Mitaka changes:
- support oslo.config 3.7.x series by falling back to using config_dir
  option to extract --config-dir argument value.

Change-Id: I10e399a852d9fba0fd1aea79a10e2e7c906e4b3c
Closes-Bug: #1585102
(cherry picked from commit 7f31ccb7bbe0f78a34d704c59d0562ea10029893)
'}]
commit_message:
Adopt to config_dir option being a list and not a string

Since oslo.config 3.8.0 (that included
Ibd0566f11df62da031afb128c9687c5e8c7b27ae), config_dir option is a list,
not a string. While our custom provider configuration parser for
multistring options assumes the latter.

It makes all installations that 1) pass at least one --config-dir option
in CLI and 2) enable any service plugin that relies on provider
definitions, to fail to start neutron-server. For example, this affects
any RDO Mitaka installation with *aas service plugins enabled.

Since Newton requires >=3.9.0, we are fine to switch to the list type
without any code to support backwards compatibility with older option
type. For Mitaka backport, we will need to handle both cases.

Mitaka changes:
- support oslo.config 3.7.x series by falling back to using config_dir
  option to extract --config-dir argument value.

Change-Id: I10e399a852d9fba0fd1aea79a10e2e7c906e4b3c
Closes-Bug: #1585102
(cherry picked from commit 7f31ccb7bbe0f78a34d704c59d0562ea10029893)

added_lines: import os import shutil class NeutronModuleConfigDirTestCase(base.BaseTestCase): def setup_config(self): self.config_parse(args=['--config-dir', base.ETCDIR]) def test_can_parse_multi_opt_service_provider_from_conf_dir(self): mod = provconf.NeutronModule('neutron_test') mod.ini() self.assertEqual(['foo', 'bar'], mod.service_providers()) class NeutronModuleMultiConfigDirTestCase(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): self.tmpdir = self.get_default_temp_dir().path shutil.copyfile( os.path.join(base.ETCDIR, 'neutron_test2.conf.example'), os.path.join(self.tmpdir, 'neutron_test.conf')) super(NeutronModuleMultiConfigDirTestCase, self).setUp() def setup_config(self): self.config_parse(args=[ # NOTE(ihrachys): we expect the second directory to be checked '--config-dir', self.tmpdir, '--config-dir', base.ETCDIR ]) def test_read_configuration_from_all_matching_files(self): mod = provconf.NeutronModule('neutron_test') mod.ini() self.assertEqual(['zzz', 'foo', 'bar'], mod.service_providers()) class NeutronModuleMultiConfigFileTestCase(base.BaseTestCase): def setUp(self): self.tmpdir = self.get_default_temp_dir().path self.filepath1 = os.path.join(self.tmpdir, 'neutron_test.conf') self.filepath2 = os.path.join(base.ETCDIR, 'neutron_test.conf') shutil.copyfile( os.path.join(base.ETCDIR, 'neutron_test2.conf.example'), self.filepath1) super(NeutronModuleMultiConfigFileTestCase, self).setUp() def setup_config(self): self.config_parse(args=[ # NOTE(ihrachys): we expect both directories to be checked '--config-file', self.filepath1, '--config-file', self.filepath2 ]) def test_read_configuration_from_all_matching_files(self): mod = provconf.NeutronModule('neutron_test') mod.ini() self.assertEqual(['zzz', 'foo', 'bar'], mod.service_providers())

commit_message:
Update OSA job skip for all jobs except docs/releasenotes

This updates the job skip for OpenStack-Ansible repositories to
ensure that all jobs except docs/releasenotes are skipped if the
content in the patch only changes docs/releasenotes.

This change specifically changes this skip to act against all
OSA repositories (except the -specs repository) rather than just
the openstack/openstack-ansible repository.

For testing, the following jobs should match, and then be skipped if
the patch content only contains the designated docs changes:
- gate-openstack-ansible-dsvm-commit
- gate-openstack-ansible-linters
- gate-openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server-linters
- gate-openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server-ansible-func-centos-7-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty
- gate-openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server-ansible-func-ubuntu-xenial-nv

And the following jobs should not match, and therefore always execute:
- gate-openstack-ansible-docs
- gate-openstack-ansible-releasenotes
- gate-openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server-docs
- gate-openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server-releasenotes

Change-Id: Iddd56c6eef01e3e114becf0d09206d734b6c3c55
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/74/331574/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: ^gate-openstack-ansible.*(?!(-docs|-releasenotes))$ skip-if: - project: ^openstack/openstack-ansible.*$

commit_message:
Use elevated context to query DB in VolumeNumberWeigher

Currently tenant would fail to create volume, if cinder uses
VolumeNumberWeigher.

This will elevate tenant to admin privilege, then VolumeNumberWeigher
has the privilege to get volume count of each hosts.

Change-Id: I1aa0e8ad74d37389ad1feecef113ab8e260dfd0f
Closes-Bug: #1594294

Cleanup tempest quickstart

This commit cleans up some of the tempest quickstart to have a better
flow, use consistent terminology, and clean up some wording and
formatting.

Change-Id: I889cf6d4ba92adf3b8bf185265c5ce197009c998
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/95/336695/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. Setup a local tempest workspace. This is done by using the tempest init which also works the same as:: running:: from the Tempest workspace directory. Or you can use the ``--workspace`` argument to run in the workspace you created regarless of your current working directory. For example:: runner, like `ostestr`_. For example, from the workspace dir run::
deleted_lines: #. Setup a local working Tempest dir. This is done by using the tempest init works the same as:: cd'ing into the tempest workspace directory and running:: Or use the ``--workspace`` argument to run in the workspace you created regarless of your current working directory. For example:: runner, like `ostestr`_. For example, from the working dir running::

commit_message:
Enable eslint and karma test(Javascript test)

Change-Id: If408a8556ac8028193ccc331b1eb6ee27c170dcf
Implements: blueprint enable-javascript-test
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin-dashboard refs/changes/66/336666/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* * Shim for Javascript unit tests; supplying expected global features. * This should be removed from the codebase once i18n services are provided. * Taken from default i18n file provided by Django. */ var horizonPlugInModules = []; (function (globals) { var django = globals.django || (globals.django = {}); django.pluralidx = function (count) { return (count == 1) ? 0 : 1; }; /* gettext identity library */ django.gettext = function (msgid) { return msgid; }; django.ngettext = function (singular, plural, count) { return (count == 1) ? singular : plural; }; django.gettext_noop = function (msgid) { return msgid; }; django.pgettext = function (context, msgid) { return msgid; }; django.npgettext = function (context, singular, plural, count) { return (count == 1) ? singular : plural; }; django.interpolate = function (fmt, obj, named) { if (named) { return fmt.replace(/%\(\w+\)s/g, function(match){return String(obj[match.slice(2,-2)])}); } else { return fmt.replace(/%s/g, function(match){return String(obj.shift())}); } }; /* formatting library */ django.formats = { "DATETIME_FORMAT": "N j, Y, P", "DATETIME_INPUT_FORMATS": [ "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S.%f", "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M", "%Y-%m-%d", "%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S", "%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S.%f", "%m/%d/%Y %H:%M", "%m/%d/%Y", "%m/%d/%y %H:%M:%S", "%m/%d/%y %H:%M:%S.%f", "%m/%d/%y %H:%M", "%m/%d/%y" ], "DATE_FORMAT": "N j, Y", "DATE_INPUT_FORMATS": [ "%Y-%m-%d", "%m/%d/%Y", "%m/%d/%y" ], "DECIMAL_SEPARATOR": ".", "FIRST_DAY_OF_WEEK": "0", "MONTH_DAY_FORMAT": "F j", "NUMBER_GROUPING": "3", "SHORT_DATETIME_FORMAT": "m/d/Y P", "SHORT_DATE_FORMAT": "m/d/Y", "THOUSAND_SEPARATOR": ",", "TIME_FORMAT": "P", "TIME_INPUT_FORMATS": [ "%H:%M:%S", "%H:%M:%S.%f", "%H:%M" ], "YEAR_MONTH_FORMAT": "F Y" }; django.get_format = function (format_type) { var value = django.formats[format_type]; if (typeof(value) == 'undefined') { return format_type; } else { return value; } }; /* add to global namespace */ globals.pluralidx = django.pluralidx; globals.gettext = django.gettext; globals.ngettext = django.ngettext; globals.gettext_noop = django.gettext_noop; globals.pgettext = django.pgettext; globals.npgettext = django.npgettext; globals.interpolate = django.interpolate; globals.get_format = django.get_format; globals.STATIC_URL = '/static/'; globals.WEBROOT = '/'; }(this));

commit_message:
Huawei: Support huawei consistency group

Adding support for consistency groups in huawei driver.
supports the following interfaces:
1.create_consistencygroup
2.delete_consistencygroup
3.update_consistencygroup
4.create_cgsnapshot
5.delete_cgsnapshot

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint support-huawei-consistency-group
Change-Id: Ib35c382d1cc008f483a60da557781435dde098e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/30/260930/40 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.StrOpt('metro_san_user', default=None, help='The remote metro device san user.'), cfg.StrOpt('metro_san_password', default=None, help='The remote metro device san password.'), cfg.StrOpt('metro_domain_name', default=None, help='The remote metro device domain name.'), cfg.StrOpt('metro_san_address', default=None, help='The remote metro device request url.'), cfg.StrOpt('metro_storage_pools', default=None, help='The remote metro device pool names.'), def _get_cggroup_type(self, group): specs = {} type_id = group['volume_type_id'].split(",") if type_id[0]: ctxt = context.get_admin_context() volume_type = volume_types.get_volume_type(ctxt, type_id[0]) specs = dict(volume_type).get('extra_specs') opts = self._get_volume_params_from_specs(specs) return opts def create_consistencygroup(self, context, group): """Creates a consistencygroup.""" model_update = {'status': 'available'} opts = self._get_cggroup_type(group) if opts.get('hypermetro'): metro = hypermetro.HuaweiHyperMetro(self.client, self.rmt_client, self.configuration, self.db) metro.create_consistencygroup(group) else: msg = _("The cggroup is not support the current volumetype.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) return model_update def delete_consistencygroup(self, context, group): opts = self._get_cggroup_type(group) if opts.get('hypermetro'): volumes = self.db.volume_get_all_by_group(context, group['id']) metro = hypermetro.HuaweiHyperMetro(self.client, self.rmt_client, self.configuration, self.db) return metro.delete_consistencygroup(context, group, volumes) else: msg = _("The cggroup is not support the current volumetype.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) def update_consistencygroup(self, context, group, add_volumes, remove_volumes): model_update = {'status': 'available'} opts = self._get_cggroup_type(group) if opts.get('hypermetro'): metro = hypermetro.HuaweiHyperMetro(self.client, self.rmt_client, self.configuration, self.db) metro.update_consistencygroup(context, group, add_volumes, remove_volumes) else: msg = _("The cggroup is not support the current volumetype.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) return model_update, None, None

commit_message:
Fix raise UnableToFailover call in SolidFire

The SolidFire driver isn't raising the UnableToFailover
exception properly.  This fixes the call and adds the
reason string.

Change-Id: I2d018a29015f7db3dd51c90e262e70f4cceaac59
Closes-Bug: #1597483
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/35/335635/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove faultwrap middleware

The placement API uses webob exceptions directly with a customer
json formatter to align with the API-WG errors guideline. There we
neither want nor need faultwrap.

In addition, removing faultwrap begins the process of removing bits
of nova from the placement API and making the entry in paste.ini
smaller. Eventually paste will not be required at all.

There will still need to be some form of middleware that transforms
exceptions lower down in the stack into webob exceptions. That will
arrive in follow up patches that have code to exercise such things.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: Id87db4819d4d3226d889c01bbac90028a626a2b6

commit_message:
Use --subproject instead of deprecated --service option

The --service option to neutron-db-manage is deprecated and will be
removed soon. Use --subproject instead.

Related-Bug: #1501380

Note on backport (amotoki): this option is just deprecated in Mitaka,
but it is better to use the recommended way.

Change-Id: I2b6920945daa7b0d26a6d4ce038cb97944c28e9e
(cherry picked from commit a125643cacef2e7acabaa472bb14a4f7032bd64f)

commit_message:
[networking] Do not use a separate link definition

A separate link defintion prevents translators from
translating a link label.

Change-Id: Id14bfc51c3e8fbb39ba8070606fe5355827a0aa5
(cherry picked from commit 67aacead659b4d67c2695fa1a61f78c49b8c95a2)

commit_message:
[networking-guide] Change l3 ha config in dvr_ha_snat

The fix include:
1.In the guide, ha_confs_path is DevStack path, Neutron default
ha_confs_path is $state_path/ha_confs, we do not need to make
an extra directory store it.
2.Remove another two default configurations for ha vrrp.
3.Remove no longer exist conf router_delete_namespaces.
4.Change entrypoint name for OVSInterfaceDriver.

Change-Id: I9ff5fb538d1b69b0ad091fde6644e110607007ed
(cherry picked from commit c65c622240aee69df6ec436f2d63ca95c850f20c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/11/336811/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: interface_driver = openvswitch interface_driver = openvswitch
deleted_lines: router_delete_namespaces = True ha_confs_path = /opt/stack/data/neutron/ha_confs ha_vrrp_auth_type = PASS ha_vrrp_advert_int = 2 interface_driver = neutron.agent.linux.interface.OVSInterfaceDriver interface_driver = neutron.agent.linux.interface.OVSInterfaceDriver

commit_message:
[networking-guide] Fix wrong section for bgp agent

Configuration bgp_speaker_driver and bgp_router_id should
in [BGP] section of bgp_dragent.ini

Also a trivial fix for router name.

Closes-Bug: #1596173
Change-Id: I35cec38d6a1c13938ef7a63bbf64a54484804866
(cherry picked from commit e3be76b230ee41e62531e4ee06f931dfd64d87c7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/10/336810/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [BGP] [BGP] $ neutron router-port-list router

commit_message:
Provide Kaminario K2 all-flash array FC driver

The purpose is to provide cinder driver for
Kaminario K2 all-flash FC array. It will include the minimum
set of features required by the Newton(N) release.

run-Kaminario K2FC CI
DocImpact
Implements: blueprint kaminario-fc-cinder-driver
Co-Authored-By: Nikesh Mahalka <Nikesh.Mahalka.ctr@kaminario.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sreedhar Varma<Sreedhar.Varma.ctr@kaminario.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ido Benda<Ido.Benda@kaminario.com>

Change-Id: Ib8154c720537a86a3fa9c8f7429e27f5ee8db151

commit_message:
VNF manual and auto scaling

blueprint: #vnf-scaling

Change-Id: Ia6135bb6956511fb5450e6c34d6011ab8495380d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker-specs refs/changes/77/318577/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========================== VNF manual and Auto-scaling =========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/vnf-scaling Add support to scale the deployed VNF manually and automatically. Problem description =================== ETSI MANO architecture describes to support scale in/out the deployed VNF on the event of abnormality. Some time user or global orchestrator would want to trigger the scaling while tacker monitoring driver also would trigger the scaling. In Tacker no such feature exist today. Proposed change =============== How to form required heat scaling resource type in heat ------------------------------------------------------- In OpenStack, heat does provide an feature to setup a scaling group, which can be scaled in/out based on the pre-defined scaling policy. Here scaling group can contain any OpenStack resource such as nova instance, cinder volume, etc, where as scaling policy helps to scale in/out in numbers, percentage, etc. so this heat feature could be used to accomplish the scaling of VDU in tacker as mentioned below: #. Model the complete VNFD elements to be part of heat scaling group OS::Heat::ScalingGroup. For example, consider a simple VNFD VDU. Now we wanted this VDU to be scaled in/out between 2 to 5 counts with initial setup with 3 elements. In this case, use the below heat template to setup the scale group. .. code-block:: ini heat_template_version: 2016-04-08 resources: vdu: type: <custom type> vdu_scaling_group: type: OS::Heat::ScalingGroup properties: min_size: 2 max_size: 5 desired_capacity:3 resource: type: OS::Nova::Instance properties: flavor: m1.medium NOTE: * here, custom type would capture the complete VNFD as single heat HOT template and same would be used as a whole to scale in/out. * Scale group could be modeled in TOSCA, and same needs to be supported in heat template-traslator to convert in into heat scaling group. * Make use of vnfd template parameterization to customize min_size, max_size, desired_capacity and flavor based on scaling need and same has to made as template parameters in above heat template. Once scaling group is ready, scaling policy needs to be configured as below one for scale-in and another for scale-out: .. code-block:: ini vdu_scale_up_policy: type: OS::Heat::ScalingPolicy properties: adjustment_type: change_in_capacity cooldown: 120 scaling_adjustment: 1 vdu_scale_down_policy: type: OS::Heat::ScalingPolicy properties: adjustment_type: change_in_capacity cooldown: 60 scaling_adjustment: -1 NOTE: * cooldown is the time-window in seconds of scale in/out event and this will be varying based on the VNF. * Add the scale group reference id in both of these policies. * To monitor the scale group using the alarm based monitoring drvier, following setup to be made in scaling element: In scaling VDU element, set the metadata as below with unique identifier per scale group: .. code-block:: ini resources: vdu_scaling_group: properties: resource: metadata: {"metering.stack": <XXX>} In alarm based monitoring driver, its mandatory to set the matching metadata with same unique identifier as below: .. code-block:: ini vdu_scale_up_alarm: type: OS::Ceilometer::Alarm properties: matching_metadata: {'metadata.user_metadata.stack': <XXX>} NOTE: * When scaling is supported, it would mandates the Load-balancer among the VDU in scaling group. So it needs to be added as part of scaling group resource element How to model the scaling ------------------------ Model the Scaling requirements into VNFD as below, which would help to define the scaling policy as below: TOSCA model: .. code-block:: ini topology_template: node_templates: VDU1: type: tosca.nodes.nfv.VDU.Tacker properties: scaling_policy: min: 1 max: 5 cooldown: 120 adjustment_step: -1 Tacker model: vdus: vdu1: scaling_policy: min: 1 max: 5 cooldown: 120 adjustment_step: +1 Alternatives ------------------ None Data model impact ------------------ None REST API impact ------------------ /v1.0/vnfs/<vnf1>/scale?type=[in/out] Security ------------------ Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ------------------ None Implementation =============== Assignee(s) ------------------ Primary assignee: Kanagaraj Manickam Work Items ------------------ #. Model scaling in vnfd/TOSCA and update tosca-translator for the same. #. Update heat infra driver to handle scaling. #. Update the required REST API and enable the same in python-tackerclient #. Enhance the horizon to scale in/out the live VNF. #. Create a sample TOSCA template with scaling requirements. #. Update the user documents. #. Add the required test cases. #. Add scale_in and scale_out actions for triggering scaling from monitor driver. Dependencies ============ None Reference ========= [1] http://docs.oasis-open.org/tosca/tosca-nfv/v1.0/tosca-nfv-v1.0.pdf
